title: Soy-Calamansi Chicken Adobo
summary: A bright, citrus-forward take on the Filipino staple with caramelized garlic and silky sauce.
description: This adobo layers classic soy-vinegar braise with fragrant calamansi, toasted garlic, and silky coconut reduction for a modern yet familiar experience.
steps: Marinate chicken with soy sauce, vinegar, calamansi, garlic, peppercorns, and bay leaves for at least 30 minutes.
Sear chicken skin-side down until caramelized. Add onions and sauté until translucent.
Pour in the marinade. Simmer covered for 20 minutes, turning halfway.
Stir in coconut milk and banana ketchup. Reduce uncovered until glossy and thick.
Serve over jasmine rice with extra calamansi and crispy garlic chips.

title: Coco Kare-Kare with Burnt Peanut Butter
summary: Velvety oxtail stew enriched with toasted peanuts, annatto oil, and charred banana heart.
description: A contemporary kare-kare that keeps tradition intact while leaning into roasted nutty depth and coconut silkiness.
steps: Simmer oxtail and pork belly with aromatics until tender, reserve broth.
Sauté garlic and onions in annatto oil until aromatic.
Whisk peanut butter, toasted rice, and coconut milk with broth to form silky sauce.
Combine meats, sauce, and blanched vegetables. Simmer until thickened.
Serve with banana-ketchup spiced bagoong on the side.

title: Sunrise Tamarind Sinigang
summary: Bright tamarind broth with sweet prawns, crunchy labanos, and charred tomatoes.
description: This sinigang balances tart tamarind and charred heirloom tomatoes for a sunrise-colored broth topped with flash-poached seafood.
steps: Caramelize onions and char tomatoes in a deep pot.
Pour in broth and tamarind pulp. Simmer with radish until tender.
Add okra and shrimp. Poach gently until shrimp turn opaque.
Stir in kangkong leaves, adjust seasoning with fish sauce.
Serve steaming with jasmine rice and calamansi.

title: Fluffy Ube Coconut Hotcakes
summary: Brunch-ready ube pancakes layered with coconut cream, latik crumble, and muscovado drizzle.
description: These purple hotcakes marry airy Japanese souffle technique with Filipino pantry staples for a show-stopping brunch plate.
steps: Combine dry ingredients; whisk wet ingredients separately with ube halaya.
Fold whipped egg whites into batter for maximum lift.
Cook on buttered skillet until edges set and centers jiggle.
Layer with coconut cream, latik crumble, and muscovado syrup.
Serve immediately with toasted coconut flakes.

title: Plant-Powered Mushroom Sisig
summary: Crispy mushroom and tofu sisig with calamansi-soy glaze and sizzling kamayan energy.
description: All the umami of Pampanga-style sisig minus the pork, thanks to smoky oyster mushrooms and tofu char.
steps: Roast mushrooms at high heat until edges crisp.
Pan-fry tofu cubes until golden, then toss with onions and chilies.
Deglaze with calamansi-soy glaze; finish with vegan mayo for creaminess.
Serve sizzling with garlic rice, top with charred calamansi.

title: Million Dollar Spaghetti
summary: Million Dollar Spaghetti is a crowd-pleaser featuring tender pasta and creamy cheese, ideal for gatherings and family lunches.
description: Million Dollar Spaghetti is a crowd-pleaser featuring tender pasta and creamy cheese, ideal for gatherings and family lunches.

ingredients.name: 1/2 cup unsalted butter sliced into 6 portions
salt and ground black pepper to taste

steps.instruction: Start by cooking the spaghetti. Boil 2 quarts of water and then cook the spaghetti based on package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta water and save it for later.32 ounces spaghetti noodles
Place the spaghetti in a large bowl and add half of the butter quickly while the noodles are hot. Toss until the spaghetti is completely coated with butter. Set aside.1/2 cup unsalted butter

Cook the sauce by heating a cooking pot and adding the ground beef. Cook the beef using high heat setting until the fat gets rendered (note: the rendered fat becomes the oil).48 ounces spaghetti sauce, 1 lb. ground beef
Scoop the oil out of the pot and then add the ground Italian sausage. Sauté for 3 minutes.1 lb. ground Italian sausage
Add the minced onion and garlic. Continue to sauté for 2 to 3 minutes more.1 yellow onion, 5 cloves garlic

Pour the spaghetti sauce into the pot. Also add ¾ cup of pasta water. Let the mixture boil. Once boiling, adjust the heat to a simmer. Cover the pot and simmer for 15 minutes (or until the sauce thickens) while stirring occasionally. Season with dried basil, salt, and ground black pepper. Set aside.1 teaspoon dried basil, salt and ground black pepper to taste

Combine all the cheese mixture ingredients in a bowl. Fold until well blended. Set aside.8 ounces cream cheese, 1/2 cup sour cream, 2 cups ricotta cheese, 2 cups mozzarella cheese, 1 cup sharp cheddar cheese
Preheat your oven to 350 F.
Meanwhile, assemble the Million Dollar Spaghetti by placing half of the spaghetti in a baking tray. Level it and make sure that the entire surface of the baking tray is covered.
Top with the cheese mixture and spread it out evenly.
Arrange the remaining spaghetti over the cheese mixture and distribute it evenly.
Add the remaining butter and pour the meat sauce over it. Spread the sauce ensuring that the spaghetti is completely covered.
Sprinkle and distribute the remaining 1 cup of shredded cheddar cheese on top.1 cup sharp cheddar cheese
Bake for 25 to 35 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let it cool down for 10 minutes.
Serve with garlic bread. Share and enjoy!

title: Tuna Pesto Pasta Recipe Creamy Version
summary: Indulge in a creamy pesto pasta dish that highlights tuna and adds a delectable twist to your everyday pasta recipes.
description: Indulge in a creamy pesto pasta dish that highlights tuna and adds a delectable twist to your everyday pasta recipes.

ingredients.name: salt and ground black pepper to taste

steps.instruction: Boil the penne pasta al dente (see notes below) according to package instructions. Drain the pasta water. Set both aside.16 ounces penne pasta
Melt butter in a pan. Add olive oil.2 tablespoons butter, 2 teaspoons olive oil
Sauté the onion for 30 seconds.1 onion
Add the garlic. Continue sautéing until the onion softens and the garlic starts to brown. Note: Do not brown the garlic completely. (see notes below)8 cloves garlic
Add the tuna. Sauté for 1 minute.10 ounces tuna
Add the pesto sauce. Stir and continue cooking for another minute.½ cup pesto sauce
Pour Nestle all-purpose cream and 3 tablespoons of pasta water.250 ml. Nestle All-Purpose Cream
Season with salt and ground black pepper. Gently stir the mixture.salt and ground black pepper to taste
Add the cooked penne pasta into the pan. Toss until coated completely.
Add the Parmesan cheese. Toss. (see notes below)¼ cup Parmesan cheese
Transfer to a serving plate. Serve and enjoy!

title: Filipino Chicken ala King with Creamy Sauce
summary: Discover why Filipino Chicken ala King is a favorite! Enjoy crispy chicken in a rich sauce, perfect with rice.
description: Discover why Filipino Chicken ala King is a favorite! Enjoy crispy chicken in a rich sauce, perfect with rice.

ingredients.name: salt and ground black pepper to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste

steps.instruction: Flatten the chicken breast by gently pounding it using a meat tenderizer tool (see notes below). Rub salt, ground black pepper, and garlic powder all over the chicken.8 ounces chicken breast, 1/8 teaspoon salt, 1/8 teaspoon ground black pepper, 1/8 teaspoon garlic powder

Dredge the chicken in all-purpose flour. Dip in the beaten egg mixture, roll it over the Good Life Breadcrumbs making sure that it gets completely coated. Let it rest for 5 minutes.1 egg, ¼ cup all-purpose flour, 1 cup Good Life breadcrumbs
Heat oil in a pan. Deep fry the chicken until it turns golden brown. Remove the chicken from the pan and arrange on a serving plate. Set aside.1 cup cooking oil

Cook the side dish by melting 2 tablespoons of butter in a pan. Saute the corn for 2 minutes. Season with  garlic powder, salt and ground black pepper. Set aside.2 tablespoons butter, 1 1/2 cups sweet corn kernels, salt and ground black pepper to taste, 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder

Make the sauce by melting the butter in a saucepan. Sauté garlic, onion, and carrot for 2 minutes. Add the flour and stir until lumps form. Pour the milk. Stir until the sauce thickens. Season with chicken powder, salt, and ground black pepper. Add the all-purpose cream, pimiento, and parsley. Stir and cook for 30 seconds.3 cloves garlic, 3 teaspoons onion, 2 tablespoons carrot, 2 teaspoons chicken powder, 4 tablespoons butter, 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour, 4 ounces pimiento, 2 teaspoons parsley, 1 cup all-purpose cream, 1 cup fresh milk, salt and ground black pepper to taste, 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
Pour the sauce over the chicken. Serve with sauteed corn and rice. Share and enjoy.

title: Filipino Pancit Recipe
summary: Enjoy the taste of the Philippines with our easy-to-follow pancit recipe. Made with bihon and canton, it's a delicious and satisfying meal.
description: Enjoy the taste of the Philippines with our easy-to-follow pancit recipe. Made with bihon and canton, it's a delicious and satisfying meal.

ingredients.name: Ground black pepper and fish sauce to taste

steps.instruction: Heat the oil in a large wok. Sauté garlic and onion.1/2 tbsp garlic minced, 3 tbsp cooking oil, 1 onion chopped
Add the pork. Sauté until it turns light brown.1/2 lb. pork belly

Pour the soy sauce and then add oyster sauce and water. Let boil. Cover the wok. simmer for 20 minutes or until the pork becomes tender. Note: add water as needed.1/4 cup soy sauce, 2 tablespoons oyster sauce, 4 cups water
Add Maggi Magic Chicken Cube, carrots, and cabbage. Stir and cook for 1 minute.1 cup carrot, 1 Maggi Magic Chicken Cube, 1/2 small cabbage chopped
Add the pancit bihon and canton. Let it soak completely in the sauce. Continue cooking until the noodles are soft enough to be tossed.1/2 lb pancit bihon, 1/2 lb pancit canton
Gently toss the noodles until all the ingredients are well distributed.
Add parsley, and then season with ground black pepper and fish sauce.1/2 cup parsley, Ground black pepper and fish sauce to taste
Cover the wok. Simmer for 3 minutes.
Turn the heat off. Transfer to a serving plate.
Serve hot. Share and enjoy!

title: Sinigang na Sardinas
summary: Make a quick and delicious Sinigang na Sardinas with canned sardines. A flavorful Filipino stew in under 15 minutes!
description: Make a quick and delicious Sinigang na Sardinas with canned sardines. A flavorful Filipino stew in under 15 minutes!

ingredients.name: 75 grams Maggi Magic Sinigang with Gabi
Fish sauce and ground black pepper to taste

steps.instruction: Separate the mackerel from the oil using a kitchen strainer. Set both aside.45 oz mackerel
Heat cooking oil and then sauté the onions until the layers separate.3 tablespoons cooking oil, 2 pieces onions
Add ginger and garlic. Continue to sauté until the garlic starts to brown.4 thumbs  ginger, 8 cloves garlic
Add the tomatoes. Sauté for 1 minute.5 pieces tomatoes
Pour the oil from the canned mackerel into the cooking pot. Add 1 tablespoon of fish sauce and ½ teaspoon of ground black pepper. Stir.Fish sauce and ground black pepper to taste
Add miso paste and pour 1 ½ quarts of water. Let it boil.1/4 cup miso paste
Add the daikon radish. Continue cooking in medium heat setting for 5 minutes.6 ounces daikon radish
Add Maggi Magic Sinigang with Gabi. Stir.75 grams Maggi Magic Sinigang with Gabi
Add the eggplant. Boil for 2 minutes.3 pieces eggplant
Add the okra, long green peppers, and string beans.12 pieces okra, 4 pieces long green peppers, 15 pieces string beans
Pour the remaining water, cover the pot, and let it re-boil. Continue cooking for 2 minutes.
Put the mackerel into the pot. Gently stir.
Add the water spinach (kangkong). Cook for 2 to 3 minutes.1 bunch  water spinach
Season with more fish sauce and ground black pepper as needed.Fish sauce and ground black pepper to taste
Transfer to a serving bowl. Serve hot.
Share and enjoy!

title: Pocherong Manok
summary: Learn how to make Pocherong Manok, a hearty Filipino stew with bone-in chicken and a medley of nutritious ingredients for a delightful meal.
description: Learn how to make Pocherong Manok, a hearty Filipino stew with bone-in chicken and a medley of nutritious ingredients for a delightful meal.

ingredients.name: 2 lbs chicken cut into serving pieces
3 pieces saba bananas sliced diagonally (see notes below)1
2 pieces potatoes sliced into large cubes
Fish sauce and ground black pepper to taste

steps.instruction: Heat the cooking oil in a wok. Fry the bananas and potatoes until it starts to brown. Set aside.3 pieces saba bananas, 2 pieces potatoes
Leave around 3 tablespoons of oil in the wok. Pan-fry the chicken for 2 minutes on each side. Remove the chicken and set aside.2 lbs chicken
Add 2 tablespoons more of cooking oil. Sauté the onion for 1 minute.1 yellow onion
Stir-in the garlic. Continue sautéing until it starts to brown and then add the tomatoes. Sauté it for 1 minute.5 cloves garlic, 2 pieces tomatoes
Add the chorizo. Stir and then add back the chicken. Continue to sauté this for 2 minutes.2 pieces Chorizo de bilbao
Add the tomato paste and pour 2 cups of water into the wok. Let it boil.3 tablespoons tomato paste, 2 cups water
Add Maggi Magic Chicken Cube. Stir,1 Maggi Magic Chicken Cube
Add the chickpeas, potatoes, and bananas. Cook for 2 minutes.14 ounces chickpeas (garbanzos)
Put the long green beans and cabbage. Cover and continue cooking for 3 minutes.15 pieces long green beans, ½ head  cabbage
Season with fish sauce and ground black pepper.Fish sauce and ground black pepper to taste
Add the bok choy. Cover the wok. Turn the heat off and let the residual heat cook it for 2 minutes.1 bunch  bok choy
Transfer to a serving bowl. Serve with rice.
Share and enjoy!

title: Filipino Fried Chicken
summary: Discover the secret to perfect Filipino Fried Chicken with a unique marinade that delivers outstanding flavor and crunch.
description: Discover the secret to perfect Filipino Fried Chicken with a unique marinade that delivers outstanding flavor and crunch.

steps.instruction: Combine the marinade ingredients in a bowl. Mix well.16 grams Maggi Magic Sarap, 3 pieces calamansi, ½ teaspoon ground black pepper, 1 teaspoon paprika, 1/4  cup soy sauce
Put the chicken in a resealable bag. Pour-in the marinade mixture. Let all the air out of the bag, seal it, and then place inside the refrigerator. Marinate for at least 1 hour.1 whole chicken
Combine the breading ingredients in a bowl. Mix well.2 teaspoon garlic powder, 1 teaspoon onion powder, ⅛ teaspoon baking powder, 2 tablespoons cornstarch, 10 tablespoons all-purpose flour
Dredge the marinated chicken in the breading mixture. Shake off the excess and place the chicken on a plate.
Meanwhile, heat the cooking oil in a wok until it reaches 300 F.2 cups cooking oil
Deep fry the chicken for 25 minutes while turning the chicken over in the middle of the process.
Remove the Filipino fried chicken from the wok. Place it over a wire rack to cool down. (See notes below)2
Transfer to a serving plate. Serve with Filipino Chicken Gravy.
Share and enjoy!

title: Broken Lasagna
summary: Broken lasagna in one pan with beef, tomatoes, and four cheeses. This easy stovetop recipe gives you all the comfort of classic lasagna.
description: Broken lasagna in one pan with beef, tomatoes, and four cheeses. This easy stovetop recipe gives you all the comfort of classic lasagna.

steps.instruction: Heat olive oil in a large pan. Arrange the whole tomatoes around the pan.3 tablespoons olive oil, 5 pieces tomatoes
Add the ground beef in the center and sauté gently without disturbing the tomatoes until the beef browns.1 lb ground beef, 5 pieces tomatoes
Add the garlic and onion. Sauté for about 2 minutes.3 cloves garlic, 1 medium yellow onion
Peel off the tomato skins, mash the tomatoes, and stir well with the beef mixture.5 pieces tomatoes
Add tomato paste and pour in beef broth. Stir and simmer for 20 minutes.3 tablespoons tomato paste, 4 cups beef broth
Add the broken lasagna pieces. Stir occasionally and cook until al dente according to package directions.8 ounces lasagna
Season with ground black pepper and mix in the chopped fresh basil.1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper, 8 pieces fresh basil

Stir in ricotta, sharp cheddar, parmesan, and mozzarella. Gently mix until the cheeses melt and the sauce becomes creamy.1/2 cup ricotta cheese, 1/2 cup sharp cheddar, 6 tablespoons parmesan cheese, 3/4 cup mozzarella
Transfer to a serving bowl. Serve warm with garlic bread.

title: Marry Me Chicken Pasta
summary: Learn how to make Marry Me Chicken Pasta at home with this creamy and flavorful recipe for a rich and satisfying meal.
description: Learn how to make Marry Me Chicken Pasta at home with this creamy and flavorful recipe for a rich and satisfying meal.

steps.instruction: Season the chicken by mixing a pinch of salt and ground black pepper. Rub the mixture on the chicken breast until evenly coated.10 oz chicken breast, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp ground black pepper

Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat. Sprinkle paprika, Italian seasoning, and garlic powder into the oil to bloom briefly. Sear the chicken on both sides until golden and cooked through. Transfer to a board and rest, then slice.1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp Italian seasoning, 1 tsp garlic powder, 2 tbsp olive oil
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the bow tie pasta until tender. Reserve one cup of pasta water, then drain and set aside.1 lb bow tie pasta

In the same skillet, melt butter. Add minced garlic and onion, cooking until soft and fragrant. Stir in tomato paste and cook until the color deepens.2 tbsp butter, 5 cloves garlic, 1 piece onion, 3 tbsp tomato paste

Pour in chicken broth and let it simmer. Add chili flakes, cherry tomatoes, and sun dried tomatoes. Reduce the heat and stir in Nestle All Purpose Cream. Add parmesan cheese, ricotta cheese, and dried oregano. Stir gently until smooth and creamy.1/4 tsp chili flakes, 1 cup cherry tomatoes, 1/4 cup sun dried tomatoes, 250 ml Nestle All Purpose Cream, 1/2 cup parmesan cheese, 1/2 cup ricotta cheese, 1 tsp dried oregano, 2 cups chicken broth

Return the sliced chicken to the pan and add the cooked pasta. Toss to coat. If needed, loosen the sauce with a splash of reserved pasta water. Serve warm with extra parmesan on top.1 lb bow tie pasta, 1/2 cup parmesan cheese

title: Creamy Chicken Pesto Pasta
summary: Creamy Chicken Pesto Pasta made with chicken, rigatoni, broccoli, spinach, sun dried tomatoes, and three cheeses in a rich pesto cream sauce.
description: Creamy Chicken Pesto Pasta made with chicken, rigatoni, broccoli, spinach, sun dried tomatoes, and three cheeses in a rich pesto cream sauce.

ingredients.name: 1.5 lbs boneless, skinless chicken breasts cut into bite-sized pieces
0.5 cup sun dried tomato sliced into strips
0.5 cup Parmesan cheese plus more for serving

steps.instruction: Bring water to a boil. Add 1 ½ teaspoons of salt. Add broccoli florets and blanch for 1 ½ minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon and set aside.1.5 cups broccoli florets, 1.5 quarts water, salt and pepper
Add pasta to the same boiling water and cook according to package instructions until al dente. Reserve 1 cup of the cooking water, then drain and set aside.1 lb rigatoni pasta

Season chicken with garlic powder, Italian seasoning, salt, and black pepper. Heat 3 tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until golden brown and cooked through. Remove from skillet and set aside.1.5 lbs boneless, skinless chicken breasts, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, 1 teaspoon Italian seasoning, 5 tablespoons olive oil, salt and pepper

In the same skillet, reduce heat to medium and melt the butter and add remaining olive oil. Add garlic and sauté for 30 seconds until fragrant. Add the sun-dried tomato, sauté for 30 seconds.3 tablespoons butter, 5 tablespoons olive oil, 6 cloves garlic, 0.5 cup sun dried tomato
Pour chicken broth and whisk in pesto until well combined.0.5 cup chicken broth, 0.5 cup basil pesto
Stir in Carnation Everyday Creamer and add ricotta and parmesan cheeses, and stir until melted and smooth.400 ml Carnation Everyday Creamer, 0.5 cup ricotta cheese, 0.5 cup Parmesan cheese
Return the broccoli and add spinach.1.5 cups broccoli florets, 1 cup spinach

Add the chicken and pasta. Toss until coated evenly with the sauce. If sauce is too thick, add reserved pasta water a little at a time until the desired consistency is reached.1.5 lbs boneless, skinless chicken breasts, 1 lb rigatoni pasta
Add mozzarella cheese and more parmesan as needed. Toss.0.5 cup mozzarella cheese, 0.5 cup Parmesan cheese
Transfer to a serving bowl. Serve hot. Share and enjoy!

title: Creamy Tomato and Spinach Pasta
summary: Creamy Tomato and Spinach Pasta made with linguine and cherry tomatoes. Easy, flavorful, and perfect for busy nights.
description: Creamy Tomato and Spinach Pasta made with linguine and cherry tomatoes. Easy, flavorful, and perfect for busy nights.

steps.instruction: Heat the olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the garlic, onion, and red chili flakes. Saute until fragrant.2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, 5 cloves garlic, 1 piece onion, 0.5 teaspoon red chili flakes
Add the cherry tomatoes. Cook until they soften and release their juices.1 cup cherry tomatoes
Pour in the vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Add the linguine. Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, until the pasta is al dente.3.5 cups vegetable broth, 12 ounces linguine
Stir in the spinach and cook until wilted.3 cups spinach

Lower the heat. Add the Nestle All Purpose Cream, ricotta cheese, and Parmesan cheese. Toss until the pasta is evenly coated and the sauce is creamy.250 ml Nestle All Purpose Cream, 0.75 cup ricotta cheese, 3 tablespoons Parmesan cheese grated
Taste and season with salt and ground black pepper. Serve warm.Salt to taste, Ground black pepper to taste

title: Chicken Sotanghon Soup with Patola
summary: Chicken Sotanghon Soup with Patola is a comforting Filipino soup with chicken, sotanghon noodles, and patola in a flavorful clear broth.
description: Chicken Sotanghon Soup with Patola is a comforting Filipino soup with chicken, sotanghon noodles, and patola in a flavorful clear broth.

ingredients.name: ▢ 1 1/2 lbs chicken cut into serving pieces
▢ 1 piece patola peeled and sliced crosswise
▢ 2 tbsp green onions chopped, for garnish

steps.instruction: Heat annatto oil in a pot over medium heat. Sauté garlic until lightly golden, then add onion and cook until soft and fragrant.3 tbsp annatto oil, 8 cloves garlic, 1 piece onion
Add chicken pieces and cook while stirring until they turn light brown on all sides.1 1/2 lbs chicken
Pour in water and bring to a boil. Add chicken powder and simmer for 20 minutes or until chicken becomes tender. Skim any foam for a clear broth.1.5 quarts water, 1 tbsp chicken powder
Add sotanghon noodles and cook for about 3 minutes, stirring gently to prevent clumping.5 oz sotanghon noodles
Add patola slices and cook for 2 minutes until tender but not mushy.1 piece patola

Season with fish sauce and ground black pepper to taste. Ladle into bowls and top with roasted garlic and chopped green onions before serving.fish sauce, ground black pepper, 1 tbsp roasted garlic, 2 tbsp green onions

title: Salted Egg Chicken
summary: Salted Egg Chicken made easy at home. Crispy fried chicken coated in a creamy salted egg sauce with butter, chilies, and curry leaves.
description: Salted Egg Chicken made easy at home. Crispy fried chicken coated in a creamy salted egg sauce with butter, chilies, and curry leaves.

ingredients.name: 1 1/2 lbs chicken thigh fillets cut into bite size pieces
2 cups cooking oil for deep frying

steps.instruction: Place chicken in a bowl. Add Maggi Magic Sarap, then coat with beaten egg. Dredge in cornstarch and flour until well covered.1 1/2 lbs chicken thigh fillets, 1 piece egg, 1/2 cup cornstarch, 1/2 cup all purpose flour, 6 grams Maggi Magic Sarap
Heat oil in a deep pan over medium high heat. Fry chicken in batches until golden and crispy, about 4–5 minutes per batch. Drain excess oil on paper towels.2 cups cooking oil
In a clean pan, melt butter over low heat. Add garlic and sauté until lightly golden and fragrant.3 1/2 tablespoons butter, 5 cloves garlic
Add sliced chilies and curry leaves. Cook for 30 seconds until fragrant.2 pieces red chilies, 12 pieces curry leaves
Add mashed salted egg yolks. Stir until bubbly and foamy. Pour in Carnation Everyday Creamer and stir until smooth and slightly thick.5 pieces salted egg yolks, 200 ml Carnation Everyday Creamer
Season glaze with sugar and a pinch of salt. Toss in fried chicken and mix quickly until evenly coated. Transfer to a plate and serve hot with rice.1 teaspoon sugar, salt

title: Creamy Pininyahang Manok
summary: Creamy Pininyahang Manok is a Filipino chicken dish with pineapple, vegetables, and creamer for a rich and comforting flavor.
description: Creamy Pininyahang Manok is a Filipino chicken dish with pineapple, vegetables, and creamer for a rich and comforting flavor.

ingredients.name: 2 lbs chicken cut into serving pieces
fish sauce and ground black pepper to taste
1 cup cooking oil for frying and sautéing

steps.instruction: Heat oil in a pan. Fry the potatoes and carrots until they start to brown. Remove and set aside.2 medium potatoes, 2 medium carrots
Reduce the oil to 3 tablespoons. Sauté garlic, onion, and tomato until softened.2 tablespoons garlic, 1 piece onion, 2 pieces tomatoes
Add the chicken. Cook until it turns light brown.2 lbs chicken
Pour in the pineapple juice from the canned pineapple along with the pineapple chunks. Cover and simmer for 30 minutes. Add water if needed.20 ounces  pineapple chunks
Add the bell peppers, fried potatoes, and carrots. Simmer for 3 minutes.1 red bell pepper, 1 green bell pepper, 2 medium potatoes, 2 medium carrots
Season with fish sauce and ground black pepper. Pour in the Carnation Everyday Creamer. Stir and simmer for 2 minutes.fish sauce and ground black pepper, 200 ml Carnation Everyday Creamer
Transfer to a serving plate. Serve with rice.

title: Honey Garlic Pork Chops
summary: Juicy and crisp honey garlic pork chops brined for flavor, fried to golden, and glazed with a buttery garlic honey sauce.
description: Juicy and crisp honey garlic pork chops brined for flavor, fried to golden, and glazed with a buttery garlic honey sauce.

ingredients.name: salt and ground black pepper to taste

steps.instruction: Make the brine by boiling 1/2 quart of water. Add salt, peppercorns, bay leaves, and sugar. Stir well, turn off the heat, then add ice cubes and the remaining water.1/4 cup salt, 4 pieces dried bay leaves, 1 tablespoon whole peppercorns, 1 tablespoon sugar, 1 1/2 quarts water, 3 cups ice cubes
Brine the pork chops for 35 minutes. Drain and pat dry with a paper towel.3 lbs pork chops

Season pork chops with paprika and garlic powder. Add the beaten egg and toss to coat. Dredge each chop in the cornstarch and flour mixture.3 lbs pork chops, 2 teaspoons paprika, 1 piece egg, 2 teaspoons garlic powder, 4 tablespoons cornstarch, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
Heat cooking oil in a pan. Fry the pork chops until both sides are golden brown and crispy. (Optional: Double fry for extra crispiness.)3 lbs pork chops, 1 1/2 cups cooking oil
For the glaze: Melt butter in a pan. Add garlic and sauté until lightly browned.8 cloves garlic, 3 tablespoons butter
Add chili flakes and honey. Stir well.1/4 teaspoon chili flakes, 6 tablespoons honey
Pour in apple cider vinegar and water. Let boil and simmer until reduced by half.3 tablespoons apple cider vinegar, 3 tablespoons water
Season with onion powder, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper.1/2 teaspoon onion powder, 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder, salt and ground black pepper
Toss the fried pork chops in the glaze until fully coated. Transfer to a serving plate and enjoy with rice.3 lbs pork chops

title: Pata Humba (Braised Pork Hocks)
summary: Pata humba made with pork hocks simmered in pineapple juice and soy sauce with star anise, salted black beans, banana blossoms, and peanuts.
description: Pata humba made with pork hocks simmered in pineapple juice and soy sauce with star anise, salted black beans, banana blossoms, and peanuts.

ingredients.name: 4.5 lbs pork hocks sliced into serving pieces

steps.instruction: Boil the pork hocks for 10 minutes. Rinse thoroughly under cold water to remove impurities. Pat dry with paper towels.4.5 lbs pork hocks
Heat the cooking oil in a wok. Fry the pork hocks for 2 minutes per side until golden brown. Remove from the wok and set aside.3 tablespoons cooking oil, 4.5 lbs pork hocks
Using the remaining oil, sauté the garlic until it starts to brown and becomes fragrant, about 1-2 minutes.8 cloves garlic
Add the onions. Continue sautéing until they soften and become translucent, about 3-4 minutes.2 pieces yellow onions
Add the salted black beans. Mash them using your cooking spoon to release their flavor into the oil.2 tablespoons salted black beans
Add the star anise, dried bay leaves, and whole peppercorns. Sauté for 30 seconds until fragrant and the spices bloom.4 pieces star anise, 3 pieces dried bay leaves, 2 teaspoons whole peppercorns
Pour in the soy sauce, vinegar, pineapple juice, and water. Stir to combine all ingredients.1/2 cup soy sauce, 3 tablespoons vinegar, 3 cups pineapple juice, 1 cup water

Add the pork hocks back to the wok. Cover and simmer on low heat until the pork is completely tender and falls off the bone, about 1½ to 2 hours. Add water as needed to prevent burning.4.5 lbs pork hocks

Add the brown sugar, banana blossoms (if using), and peanuts. Continue cooking for 10 minutes to allow the sauce to reduce slightly and flavors to meld.1/2 cup brown sugar, 1/4 cup dried banana blossoms, 1/4 cup peanuts
Season with Maggi Magic Sarap. Taste and adjust seasoning as needed.5 grams Maggi Magic Sarap
Transfer to a serving plate. Serve hot with steamed rice. Spoon the rich sauce over the rice for the best experience.

title: Fried Pork Belly Liempo
summary: This fried pork belly recipe features tender pork slices fried until golden and crispy, served with a bold garlic chili sauce.
description: This fried pork belly recipe features tender pork slices fried until golden and crispy, served with a bold garlic chili sauce.

steps.instruction: Arrange the sliced pork belly in a pan. Season with Maggi Magic Sarap and ground black pepper.3 lbs pork belly, 8 grams Maggi Magic Sarap, ½ teaspoon ground black pepper
Add the garlic and then pour water into the pan. Boil for 10 minutes.5 cloves garlic, 1 ½ cups water
Flip the pork over and continue boiling until the water completely evaporates.
Remove the pork. Let it cool down.
Combine all-purpose flour and cornstarch in a bowl. Mix well. Dredge the boiled pork belly and shake-off excess flour. Set aside.½ cup all-purpose flour, 3 tablespoons cornstarch
Heat the oil in a clean pan. Once hot, start to fry the pork belly until it brown. Turn it over and do the same thing on the other side.½ cup cooking oil
Remove from the pan and arrange on a serving plate.

Combine all the dipping sauce ingredients in a bowl. Mix well.5 cloves garlic, 1 piece onion, 5 pieces Thai chili pepper, 1 tablespoon green onion, 1 teaspoon granulated white sugar, ¼ teaspoon ground black pepper, ¼ teaspoon salt
Serve the fried pork belly with the dipping sauce and steamed white rice. Share and enjoy!

title: Adobong Isaw ng Baboy (Tumbong Recipe)
summary: Make Adobong Isaw ng baboy with this savory, garlicky recipe using pork intestines simmered adobo-style. Perfect with rice or as pulutan.
description: Make Adobong Isaw ng baboy with this savory, garlicky recipe using pork intestines simmered adobo-style. Perfect with rice or as pulutan.

steps.instruction: Combine pork intestines, salt, and crushed ginger in a wok. Pour in water. Cover and bring to a boil. Lower the heat and simmer for 90 minutes or until the intestines becomes tender.4 lbs. pork large intestine, ¼ cup salt, 6 thumbs  ginger, 1 quart water
Remove the pork intestines from the wok. Rinse under running water and slice into serving pieces.

In a clean wok, combine crushed garlic and 1/4 cup cooking oil. Cook over low heat until garlic is golden brown. Remove the toasted garlic from the pan. Separate the oil. 1 ½ heads  garlic, ¼ cup cooking oil
Pour 3 tablespoons of oil (used to fry the garlic) back in to the pan. Add 2 teaspoons of toasted garlic.
Heat the pan and then add the sliced intestines. Saute until it browns.
Pour in soy sauce, add the cracked peppercorn, and dried bay leaves. 4 tablespoons soy sauce, 2 teaspoons  peppercorn, 3 pieces bay leaves
Add vinegar. Let it boil. Stir and add beef broth. Simmer until the liquid reduces to a quarter.6 tablespoons vinegar, 1 ½ cups beef broth
Add brown sugar and chopped chili peppers. Stir.1 tablespoon brown sugar, 6 pieces Thai chili pepper
Stir-in the oyster sauce and then add chopped green onions and the remaining toasted garlic Cook for 30 seconds.2 ½ tablespoons oyster sauce, ¼ cup green onions
Transfer to a serving plate. Serve. Share and enjoy!

title: Garlic Pepper Beef in Mushroom Gravy
summary: Learn how to make Garlic Pepper Beef in Mushroom Gravy. Tender beef stir-fried with garlic and pepper, tossed in creamy mushroom sauce.
description: Learn how to make Garlic Pepper Beef in Mushroom Gravy. Tender beef stir-fried with garlic and pepper, tossed in creamy mushroom sauce.

ingredients.name: 1/8 teaspoon ground black pepper for gravy

steps.instruction: Heat the cooking oil in a large skillet over medium heat and add the minced garlic. Cook until golden brown and crispy, about 2-3 minutes. Using a fine mesh strainer, separate the crispy garlic from the oil and set the garlic aside for garnish.1 1/2 heads garlic, 1/4 cup cooking oil
Reduce the garlic oil to 2 tablespoons in the pan. Increase heat to medium-high and sauté the sliced beef until it browns on all sides, about 4-5 minutes total.1 1/2 lbs beef sirloin

Pour in the soy sauce and oyster sauce, then season with salt, ground black pepper, and half of the toasted garlic. Stir to combine and cook for 1 minute. Remove beef from pan and set aside.2 tablespoons soy sauce, 3 tablespoons oyster sauce, 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper, 1/4 teaspoon salt

In the same pan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the flour and whisk continuously, cooking until the mixture turns golden brown, about 2-3 minutes.3 tablespoons butter, 4 tablespoons all-purpose flour

Gradually pour in the beef broth while whisking constantly to prevent lumps. Add the sliced mushrooms and bring to a simmer. Stir until the sauce thickens, about 3-4 minutes, then season with onion powder, garlic powder, salt, and ground black pepper.14 oz button mushrooms, 1/2 teaspoon onion powder, 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder, 1/8 teaspoon ground black pepper, 1 3/4 cups beef broth, salt

Add the cooked beef back to the pan and toss until well combined with the mushroom gravy. Cook for 2-3 minutes to heat through. Transfer to a serving plate, top with the remaining crispy garlic, and serve immediately.

title: Caldereta
summary: Make your gathering special with caldereta, a beloved Filipino stew made with beef in a rich, savory tomato sauce.
description: Make your gathering special with caldereta, a beloved Filipino stew made with beef in a rich, savory tomato sauce.

steps.instruction: Combine the beef neck bones, beef chuck, and soy sauce in a bowl. Mix well. Marinate for 10 minutes.3 lbs. beef neck bones, 2 lbs. beef chuck, 5 tablespoons soy sauce
Meanwhile, heat 2 cups of cooking oil in a wok. Deep fry the potatoes and carrots until it starts to brown. Remove and set aside.3 potatoes, 2 cups cooking oil, 3 carrots
Heat 3 tablespoons of oil used to fry the potatoes and carrots in a clean wok. Sauté the onion for 1 minute.2 onions
Add garlic. Continue sautéing until the garlic starts to brown.5 cloves garlic
Add the marinated beef. Sauté until the outer layer of the beef starts to turn light brown (around 3 to 5 minutes).
Pour tomato sauce and water. Cover and let boil.8 ounces tomato sauce, 4 cups water
Adjust the heat to a simmer. Continue cooking for 40 minutes.
Add tomato paste. Simmer for 20 to 35 minutes or until the beef tenderizes completely. Note: Stir occasionally and add water as needed.2 tablespoons tomato paste
Add beef powder, liver spread, peanut butter. Stir.2 teaspoons beef powder, ¼ cup liver spread, 3 tablespoons peanut butter
Add green olives and bell peppers. Cook for 3 minutes.2 red bell peppers, 5 ounces green olives, 2 green bell peppers
Season with Maggi Magic Sarap and ground black pepper. Stir.8 grams Maggi Magic Sarap, Ground black pepper to taste
Put the fried potatoes and carrots into the wok. Toss.
Add cheese. Continue cooking for 2 to 3 minutes.2 ounces cheddar cheese
Transfer to a serving bowl. Serve with rice.
Share and enjoy!

title: Retiro Beef Pares with Chicharon Bulaklak
summary: This recipe for Retiro Beef Pares lets you in on how a famous restaurant in the Philippines makes its most popular menu item
description: This recipe for Retiro Beef Pares lets you in on how a famous restaurant in the Philippines makes its most popular menu item

ingredients.name: 4 lbs. beef shank sliced large diced

steps.instruction: Start making the chicharon bulaklak by washing the ruffle fat thoroughly. Rub 2 tablespoons of salt all over it. Arrange in a cooking pot and then pour 1 quart of water. Add 5 pieces bay leaves. Cover the pot and let it boil. Once it boils, set the heat between low to medium. Continue boiling until the water evaporates completely. By this time the ruffle fat should have been tender. Remove the cover, discard the bay leaves, and continue cooking until fat slowly renders. You will notice a good amount of oil forming. Continue frying the ruffle fat in its own oil until it becomes crispy.2 lbs. pork ruffle fat, 2 tablespoons salt, 1 quart water, 5 dried bay leaves

Make the toasted garlic. This will be used for the fried rice and as a topping to the beef pares. Pour ½ cup of cooking oil and then add the minced 2 heads of garlic right away. Turn on the heat medium setting. Slowly cook the garlic as the oil heats-up while stirring gently. Continue until garlic turns golden brown. Separate the browned garlic from the garlic oil. Both ingredients will be used later.2 heads garlic, ½ cup cooking oil

Make the fried rice by heating ¼ cup of garlic oil. Add half the amount of the cooked rice (preferably leftover). Stir fry this for 1 minute. Add the remaining half and continue to stir fry for 3 minutes. Adding the rice by batch (half at a time) will make it easier for you to manage. Pour the soy sauce and then toss until the rice gets coated evenly. Season with salt and add 1 tablespoon of browned garlic. Set aside.5 cups cooked rice, 2 tablespoons soy sauce, 1 teaspoon salt

Cook the beef pares by combining beef and 1 quart water in a pressure cooker. Seal the lid and then pressure cook for 12 minutes. Depressurize the cooker and set the beef along with the liquid aside. Heat the remaining garlic oil in a wide cooking pot. Saute the ginger for 2 minutes. Add the garlic. Sauté it for 1 minute. Pour the beef along with the stock. Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, and star anise. Cover the pot and let it boil. Reduce heat to low and continue cooking for 20 minutes. Add the brown sugar and beef powder. Adjust the flavor based on your preference then combine cornstarch and ½ cup water. Mix it well and pour into the pot. Stir until the sauce thickens.4 lbs. beef shank, 5 thumbs ginger, 10 cloves garlic, 1 tablespoon beef powder, 5 pieces star anise, ½ cup soy sauce, 2 tablespoons oyster sauce, ¾ cup brown sugar, 2 quarts water, 3 tablespoons cornstarch
Transfer your beef pares, fried rice, and chicharon bulaklak to their respective serving bowls/plates and serve with toasted garlic and chopped green onions.
Serve. Share and enjoy!

title: Beef Chop Suey
summary: Rich, succulent beef with stir fried vegetables! That’s what I am teaching you how to cook today, satisfying Beef Chop Suey!
description: Rich, succulent beef with stir fried vegetables! That’s what I am teaching you how to cook today, satisfying Beef Chop Suey!

ingredients.name: 1 lb. beef top sirloin sliced into thin pieces
3 stems green onion cut into 2-inch length
½ head cabbage sliced into serving pieces
1 red bell pepper sliced into thick strips

steps.instruction: Combine the sliced beef and all the marinade ingredients in a bowl. After that, mix everything well. Set aside for 12 minutes.2 tablespoons soy sauce, 1 ½ tablespoons oyster sauce, ¼ teaspoon baking soda, 2 teaspoons cornstarch, ¼ teaspoon ground black pepper, 1 tablespoon cooking oil, 1 lb. beef top sirloin

Meanwhile, start to partially cook the vegetables. Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a wide pan. Stir fry the cabbage, snap peas, carrot, and bell pepper for 1 minute. Sprinkle some salt to flavor it and then pour ¼ cup of beef broth. Cover the pan and let the liquid boil. Continue steaming for 1 minute. Then remove the cover of the pan. Let the remaining liquid evaporate. Set the vegetables aside.½ head cabbage, 2 carrots, 1 red bell pepper, 2 cups snap peas, 3 tablespoons cooking oil, 8 grams Maggi Magic Sarap, ½ cup beef stock
Heat the remaining oil on the same pan. Once the oil gets hot, stir-fry the marinated beef until the outside part turns light brown.3 tablespoons cooking oil
Add the minced garlic, white part of the green onion, and sliced onions. Continue to stir-fry until the onion softens.5 cloves garlic, 3 stems  green onion, 1 yellow onion
Add the stir-fried vegetables. Then toss to distribute the ingredients evenly.
Pour 1 tablespoon soy sauce and remaining beef broth. Stir and continue cooking until the sauce thickens.1 tablespoon soy sauce, ½ cup beef stock
Season with Maggi Magic Sarap as needed.8 grams Maggi Magic Sarap
Transfer to a serving plate. Share and enjoy!

title: Bulalo (Beef Marrow Soup)
summary: Rich and hearty beef shank soup with bone marrow, corn, and vegetables - a Batangas specialty.
description: This iconic soup from Batangas features beef shanks slow-simmered until the marrow melts into a rich, collagen-rich broth with sweet corn and tender vegetables.
steps: Boil beef shank in water for 10 minutes, then discard water to remove scum.
Add fresh water, onion, and peppercorns. Simmer for 2.5-3 hours until tender.
Add corn and potatoes, cook for 15 minutes.
Add cabbage and cook for 5 more minutes until wilted.
Season with fish sauce and serve hot.

title: Chicken Tinola
summary: Light and refreshing chicken soup with ginger, green papaya, and moringa leaves.
description: A comforting Filipino soup known for its ginger-forward broth, tender chicken, and nutritious greens - perfect for cold weather or when feeling under the weather.
steps: Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger in oil until fragrant.
Add chicken and cook until lightly browned.
Pour in water and fish sauce. Bring to boil, then simmer for 25 mins.
Add green papaya and cook until tender.
Add malunggay leaves just before serving.

title: Pancit Bihon Guisado
summary: Classic Filipino rice noodles stir-fried with vegetables, meat, and savory soy-based sauce.
description: The quintessential Filipino birthday noodle dish symbolizing long life, featuring thin rice noodles with a colorful medley of vegetables and protein.
steps: Soak bihon in water for 10 mins, then drain.
Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant, add chicken until cooked.
Add vegetables and stir-fry briefly.
Pour broth and soy sauce, bring to simmer.
Add noodles and toss until liquid is absorbed.
Serve with calamansi wedges.

title: Lechon Kawali (Crispy Pork Belly)
summary: Deep-fried pork belly with shatteringly crispy skin and tender, juicy meat inside.
description: This beloved Filipino dish features pork belly boiled until tender then deep-fried to achieve that signature crispy skin that crackles with every bite.
steps: Boil pork belly with bay leaves, peppercorns, and salt for 1 hour until tender.
Remove and let cool completely. Refrigerate overnight for crispier results.
Pat dry thoroughly with paper towels.
Deep fry in hot oil until golden and crispy, about 15-20 mins.
Serve with lechon sauce or spiced vinegar.

title: Bicol Express
summary: Spicy pork stew cooked in coconut milk with lots of chilies - a Bicolano specialty.
description: Named after the train service to Bicol region, this fiery dish combines tender pork with creamy coconut milk and plenty of labuyo chilies.
steps: Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add pork and cook until lightly browned.
Pour coconut milk and simmer until pork is tender.
Add shrimp paste and chilies, continue cooking.
Add coconut cream and simmer until oil separates.
Serve with steamed rice.

title: Laing (Dried Taro Leaves in Coconut Milk)
summary: Creamy coconut dish with dried taro leaves, shrimp paste, and pork - another Bicolano classic.
description: This creamy Bicolano dish features dried taro leaves slowly cooked in coconut milk until meltingly tender, enriched with shrimp paste and pork.
steps: Do NOT stir the dish while cooking to prevent itchiness.
Layer ingredients in pot: taro leaves, pork, garlic, ginger, chilies.
Pour coconut milk over and simmer without stirring.
Add shrimp paste after 30 mins.
Pour coconut cream and continue cooking until oil surfaces.
Total cooking time should be about 45-50 mins.

title: Lumpia Shanghai
summary: Crispy Filipino spring rolls filled with savory pork and vegetable mixture.
description: These beloved crispy rolls are a staple at every Filipino celebration, featuring a well-seasoned pork filling wrapped in thin spring roll wrappers.
steps: Mix all filling ingredients thoroughly.
Place a spoonful of filling on wrapper edge.
Roll tightly, sealing edge with water.
Deep fry in batches until golden brown.
Serve with sweet chili sauce or banana ketchup.

title: Menudo (Pork and Liver Stew)
summary: Hearty tomato-based stew with pork, liver, and vegetables - a Filipino fiesta favorite.
description: A rich tomato-based stew featuring tender pork and liver cubes with potatoes and bell peppers, different from the Mexican tripe soup of the same name.
steps: Sauté garlic and onion, add pork and cook until browned.
Add soy sauce and cook for 2 minutes.
Pour tomato sauce and water, simmer until pork is tender.
Add potatoes and carrots, cook until almost done.
Add liver and bell peppers, cook for 5 more minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.

title: Chicken Afritada
summary: Filipino chicken stew in rich tomato sauce with potatoes, carrots, and bell peppers.
description: A Spanish-influenced Filipino dish featuring chicken pieces braised in a savory tomato sauce with tender vegetables.
steps: Sauté garlic and onion until golden.
Add chicken and cook until browned.
Pour tomato sauce and broth, simmer for 20 mins.
Add potatoes and carrots, cook until tender.
Add bell peppers and cook for 3 more minutes.
Season and serve with rice.

title: Beef Kaldereta
summary: Rich and hearty beef stew with liver spread, olives, and bell peppers in tomato sauce.
description: A festive Filipino beef stew enriched with liver spread for depth, featuring tender beef chunks in a thick tomato-based sauce.
steps: Sauté garlic and onion, add beef and brown.
Add tomato sauce and water, simmer until beef is tender (about 1 hr).
Add potatoes and carrots, cook for 15 mins.
Stir in liver spread and olives.
Add bell peppers and cook 5 more minutes.
Serve hot with rice.

title: Ginisang Monggo (Mung Bean Soup)
summary: Hearty mung bean soup with pork and leafy greens - a nutritious Friday tradition.
description: A nourishing soup traditionally served on Fridays, featuring protein-rich mung beans cooked with pork and topped with crispy chicharon.
steps: Boil mung beans until soft, set aside.
Sauté garlic, onion, tomato, and pork.
Add cooked mung beans and water.
Simmer for 20 minutes.
Season with fish sauce, add malunggay.
Top with crispy chicharon bits.

title: Tokwa't Baboy (Tofu and Pork)
summary: Crispy fried tofu and tender pork ears served with tangy soy-vinegar sauce.
description: A popular Filipino appetizer or pulutan featuring crispy tofu cubes and sliced boiled pork served with a zesty vinegar dipping sauce.
steps: Boil pork until tender, then slice.
Deep fry tofu until golden and crispy.
Make sauce: combine soy sauce, vinegar, onion, garlic, chilies.
Arrange pork and tofu on plate.
Pour sauce over or serve on the side.

title: Ginataang Kalabasa with Shrimp
summary: Creamy squash and shrimp cooked in rich coconut milk - comfort food at its finest.
description: Sweet squash and succulent shrimp simmered in creamy coconut milk, a beloved vegetable dish that pairs perfectly with fried fish.
steps: Sauté garlic and onion in a little oil.
Add coconut milk and bring to simmer.
Add squash and cook until half-tender.
Add long beans and shrimp.
Season with fish sauce.
Simmer until squash is fully cooked.

title: Pinakbet (Ilocano Mixed Vegetables)
summary: Medley of native vegetables sautéed with shrimp paste - an Ilocano classic.
description: A nutritious vegetable dish from Ilocos featuring bitter melon, squash, eggplant, and string beans unified by savory bagoong.
steps: Layer vegetables in pot starting with onion and tomatoes.
Add shrimp paste dissolved in a little water.
Cover and cook on medium heat without stirring.
After 10 mins, gently mix.
Continue cooking until vegetables are tender.
Serve with fried fish.

title: Arroz Caldo (Chicken Rice Porridge)
summary: Comforting Filipino chicken rice porridge with ginger and crispy garlic toppings.
description: The Filipino version of congee, this warming rice porridge is flavored with ginger and topped with crispy garlic, green onions, and boiled egg.
steps: Sauté ginger, garlic, and onion until fragrant.
Add chicken and cook until browned.
Add rice and toast briefly.
Pour broth and simmer until rice breaks down.
Season with fish sauce.
Top with crispy garlic, scallions, and egg halves.

title: Leche Flan
summary: Silky smooth caramel custard - the crown jewel of Filipino desserts.
description: This rich, creamy custard with burnt sugar caramel is the quintessential Filipino celebration dessert, beloved for its smooth texture and sweet flavor.
steps: Make caramel: melt sugar until amber, pour into mold.
Whisk egg yolks gently (avoid bubbles).
Add condensed and evaporated milk, vanilla.
Strain mixture into caramel-lined mold.
Steam for 45 mins or until set.
Chill overnight before unmolding.

title: Turon (Banana Spring Rolls)
summary: Crispy fried banana rolls with jackfruit, coated in caramelized sugar.
description: A beloved Filipino street food featuring ripe saba bananas and jackfruit strips wrapped in spring roll wrapper and fried to golden perfection.
steps: Roll banana in brown sugar.
Place banana and jackfruit on wrapper.
Roll tightly, seal with water.
Deep fry until golden brown.
Optional: drizzle with caramelized sugar.
Serve warm.

title: Halo-Halo
summary: The ultimate Filipino shaved ice dessert with multiple toppings and leche flan.
description: A refreshing summer treat featuring shaved ice, evaporated milk, and an array of sweet toppings including ube, leche flan, and sweetened beans.
steps: Layer sweet ingredients in tall glass.
Add generous shaved ice.
Top with ube halaya and leche flan.
Add scoop of ube ice cream.
Pour evaporated milk over.
Mix everything before eating - halo-halo means mix-mix!

title: Champorado (Chocolate Rice Porridge)
summary: Sweet chocolate rice porridge traditionally paired with dried fish - a unique Filipino combo.
description: A comforting breakfast or merienda dish of glutinous rice cooked in chocolate tablea, traditionally served with salty dried fish for contrast.
steps: Wash rice and add to pot with water.
Bring to boil, reduce heat and simmer.
When rice is soft, add tablea.
Stir until chocolate melts and thickens.
Add sugar to taste.
Serve with evaporated milk and dried fish.

title: Bangus Sisig
summary: A healthier twist on classic sisig using flaked milkfish instead of pork.
description: All the sizzling, savory goodness of sisig made with flaky milkfish, perfect for those who want a lighter but equally delicious version.
steps: Grill or fry bangus until cooked, then flake.
Sauté onion in butter until soft.
Add flaked fish, chilies, soy sauce.
Toss in calamansi juice.
Serve sizzling with raw egg on top.
Mix everything at the table.

title: Sinigang sa Baboy (Pork Sinigang)
summary: Classic sour pork soup with tamarind broth and fresh vegetables.
description: The quintessential Filipino sour soup featuring tender pork ribs in a tamarind-soured broth loaded with vegetables.
steps: Boil pork in water, skim scum.
Add tomatoes and onion, simmer 45 mins.
Add tamarind paste and radish.
Cook until radish is tender.
Add long beans, then kangkong.
Season with fish sauce.

title: Classic Adobong Pusit
summary: Tender squid braised in soy sauce, vinegar, and its own ink for a savory, briny delight.
description: A beloved seafood variation of the classic adobo. Fresh squid is cooked quickly in a tangy, savory sauce enriched with squid ink, creating a striking black dish that's perfect with steaming white rice.
steps: Clean the squid carefully, keeping the ink sacs separate. Slice the body into rings.
In a pan, heat oil and sauté garlic, onions, and tomatoes until softened.
Add the squid and cook for 2 minutes. Do not overcook.
Pour in soy sauce, vinegar, water, and the squid ink. Add bay leaves.
Bring to a boil without stirring to let the vinegar cook off.
Simmer for another 3-5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Add green chilies if using. Serve hot with rice.

title: Pancit Palabok Special
summary: Rice noodles smothered in a golden shrimp sauce, topped with chicharon, shrimp, and eggs.
description: A festive noodle dish featuring thin rice noodles covered in a rich, orange shrimp-infused sauce. It's elaborately topped with crushed pork cracklings (chicharon), tinapa flakes, shrimp, hard-boiled eggs, and green onions.
steps: Soak rice noodles in water until soft. Boil briefly until cooked, then drain.
Make shrimp stock by boiling shrimp heads in water, then strain.
Sauté garlic and onions. Add shrimp stock and bring to a boil.
Add annatto water for color. Season with fish sauce.
Thicken sauce with cornstarch mixture. Simmer until desired consistency.
Place noodles on a platter. Pour sauce over noodles.
Top with cooked shrimp, tinapa flakes, crushed chicharon, egg slices, fried garlic, and spring onions.
Serve with calamansi on the side.

title: Tortang Talong (Eggplant Omelet)
summary: Smoky roasted eggplant dipped in egg mixture and pan-fried to golden perfection.
description: A humble yet satisfying dish made by grilling whole eggplants until charred, peeling them, flattening them, and frying them with a beaten egg mixture. Often served with banana ketchup.
steps: Grill eggplants over an open flame until skin is charred and flesh is soft.
Let cool, then peel off the charred skin, keeping the stem intact.
Flatten the eggplant flesh with a fork.
Beat eggs with salt and pepper in a wide bowl.
Dip each eggplant into the egg mixture, coating well.
Heat oil in a pan. Fry the eggplants until golden brown on both sides.
Serve hot, traditionally with banana ketchup.

title: Ginataang Hipon with Kalabasa
summary: Succulent shrimp and squash simmered in rich, creamy coconut milk.
description: A creamy and savory dish combining the sweetness of squash (kalabasa) and string beans (sitaw) with fresh shrimp, all cooked in coconut milk (gata) spiced with ginger and chili.
steps: Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger in oil until fragrant.
Add the squash and cook for 2 minutes.
Pour in coconut milk and bring to a gentle simmer. Cook until squash is half-tender.
Add the shrimp and string beans. Season with bagoong or fish sauce.
Simmer until shrimp turns pink and vegetables are cooked. Do not overcook the shrimp.
Add chilies if desired. Serve hot with rice.

title: Biko (Sweet Rice Cake)
summary: Sticky rice cake cooked in coconut milk and brown sugar, topped with latik.
description: A classic Filipino kakanin (rice cake) made from glutinous rice (malagkit), coconut milk, and brown sugar. It is traditionally topped with latik (coconut curd) for a nutty contrast to the sweet, chewy base.
steps: Wash glutinous rice and cook with water in a rice cooker or pot (slightly less water than usual).
In a large wok, combine coconut milk and brown sugar. Boil until thickened into a syrup.
Lower heat. Add the cooked rice to the coconut syrup.
Stir constantly to prevent sticking. Cook until the mixture is very sticky and pulls away from the pan.
Transfer to a lined baking tray or bilao. Flatten the surface.
Top with latik (fried coconut curds) if available.
Let cool before slicing.

title: Crispy Pata
summary: Deep-fried pork leg with blistered, crackling skin and tender meat.
description: The ultimate Filipino feast dish. A whole pork leg is simmered with spices until tender, dried, and then deep-fried until the skin is incredibly crispy while the meat remains juicy. Served with a soy-vinegar dipping sauce.
steps: In a large pot, place pork leg, garlic, onion, bay leaves, peppercorns, and salt. Cover with water.
Boil for 1.5 to 2 hours until meat is tender but not falling apart.
Remove pork from pot and let it dry completely. Refrigerating it uncovered overnight helps achieve crispier skin.
Heat generous amount of oil in a deep pot.
Deep fry the pork leg until golden brown and skin is blistered and crispy. Be careful of oil splatters.
Serve with a dipping sauce of vinegar, soy sauce, garlic, onions, and chili.

title: Kinilaw na Isda (Filipino Ceviche)
summary: Fresh raw fish cured in vinegar and calamansi with ginger, onions, and chili.
description: A refreshing appetizer made with fresh raw fish (like Tanigue or Tuna) 'cooked' in vinegar and citrus juices. Flavored with ginger, onions, and chilies, sometimes with a splash of coconut milk.

ingredients.name: Fresh fish fillet (Tanigue or Tuna), cubed

steps: Wash the fish cubes in half of the vinegar, then drain. This removes the fishy smell.
In a bowl, combine the fish with the remaining vinegar and calamansi juice.
Add ginger, onions, chilies, and cucumber.
Season with salt and pepper. Toss gently.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the acid to cure the fish.
Serve chilled.

title: Dinuguan (Pork Blood Stew)
summary: Savory stew of pork meat and offal simmered in a rich, spicy dark gravy of pig blood.
description: Often called 'chocolate meat', this savory stew features pork belly and innards cooked in pig's blood, vinegar, and spices. It has a unique, rich flavor and is best paired with Puto (rice cake).
steps: Sauté garlic and onion in oil.
Add pork belly (and innards if using) and brown slightly.
Pour in vinegar and bring to a boil without stirring.
Add water/stock and bay leaves. Simmer until pork is tender.
Stir in the pig's blood (mix with a little vinegar beforehand to prevent clotting).
Simmer for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally until sauce thickens.
Add green chilies and season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot with Puto or rice.

title: Homemade Beef Tapa
summary: Sweet, salty, and garlicky cured beef slices, perfect for breakfast.
description: Thinly sliced beef cured in a marinade of soy sauce, calamansi, sugar, and lots of garlic. Pan-fried until caramelized, it's the star of the famous Tapsilog breakfast combo.

ingredients.name: Beef sirloin or brisket, thinly sliced

steps: In a bowl, mix soy sauce, calamansi juice, minced garlic, sugar, salt, and pepper.
Add the beef slices and massage the marinade into the meat.
Marinate for at least 4 hours, preferably overnight in the fridge.
Heat oil in a pan. Fry the beef slices in batches until cooked through and slightly caramelized.
Serve with garlic fried rice (sinangag) and fried egg (itlog).

title: Sinampalukang Manok
summary: Chicken soup soured with young tamarind leaves and fruit.
description: Similar to Sinigang but specifically for chicken. The broth is soured using young tamarind leaves and pulp, giving it a distinct, milder sourness compared to the tamarind fruit alone. Often includes ginger.
steps: Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger until fragrant.
Add chicken and cook until lightly browned.
Add fish sauce and cook for another minute.
Pour in water and add tamarind fruit. Bring to a boil and simmer until chicken is tender.
Remove tamarind fruit, mash them in a strainer to extract juice, and return juice to pot.
Add tamarind leaves and string beans. Cook for 3 minutes.
Add pechay/mustard leaves. Season with salt/pepper.
Serve hot.

title: Ginataang Bilo-Bilo
summary: Sweet coconut soup with chewy rice balls, jackfruit, sago, and tubers.
description: A warm, comforting dessert soup. Chewy glutinous rice balls (bilo-bilo) float in sweetened coconut milk along with cubes of sweet potato, taro, plantains, jackfruit strips, and tapioca pearls.
steps: Mix glutinous rice flour and water to form a dough. Roll into small balls (bilo-bilo).
In a pot, bring coconut milk and sugar to a simmer.
Add sweet potatoes and cook until half-done.
Add bananas and the rice balls. Simmer until balls float to the surface.
Add jackfruit and cooked sago. Simmer for another 5 minutes.
Serve warm or cold.

title: Beef Mami
summary: Hearty noodle soup with tender beef brisket, egg noodles, and rich broth.
description: A popular Filipino comfort food inspired by Chinese cuisine. Fresh egg noodles are served in a hot, flavorful beef broth with tender brisket chunks, boiled egg, and napa cabbage.
steps: Boil beef brisket and bones with onion, garlic, salt, pepper, and star anise. Simmer until beef is very tender (about 1.5-2 hours).
Remove beef, slice into cubes. Strain the broth.
Cook noodles according to package instructions. Drain.
Blanch the cabbage in the hot broth.
Assemble bowls: noodles first, then beef, cabbage, and egg.
Pour hot broth over the noodles.
Garnish with spring onions and fried garlic.

title: Paksiw na Bangus
summary: Milkfish stewed in vinegar, garlic, ginger, and vegetables.
description: A simple, sour stew that keeps well without refrigeration. Milkfish (bangus) is simmered in vinegar and water with garlic, ginger, peppercorns, and vegetables like eggplant and bitter melon.
steps: Arrange vegetables at the bottom of a pot.
Place fish slices on top.
Add garlic, ginger, peppercorns, and chilies.
Pour in vinegar and water. Add salt.
Cover and bring to a boil. Do not stir.
Simmer for 15-20 minutes until fish is cooked and vegetables are tender.
Serve with rice.

title: Embutido (Filipino Meatloaf)
summary: Steamed pork meatloaf stuffed with eggs and sausages, wrapped in foil.
description: A festive meatloaf often served during holidays. Ground pork is mixed with raisins, carrots, pickle relish, and cheese, then wrapped around hard-boiled eggs and sausages before being steamed or baked.
steps: In a bowl, mix ground pork, carrots, onion, relish, raisins, cheese, raw eggs, breadcrumbs, salt, and pepper.
Spread a portion of the mixture on aluminum foil.
Place sausage and hard-boiled egg slices in the center.
Roll the foil to form a log, sealing the ends tight.
Steam for 1 hour.
Let cool before slicing. Can be fried after steaming for extra flavor.

title: Escabeche (Sweet and Sour Fish)
summary: Fried fish topped with a colorful sweet and sour sauce with peppers and ginger.
description: A vibrant dish featuring a whole fried fish (usually Lapu-Lapu or Tilapia) smothered in a sweet and tangy sauce made with vinegar, sugar, ketchup, bell peppers, carrots, and ginger.
steps: Season fish with salt, coat with flour, and deep fry until crispy. Set aside.
Sauté ginger, garlic, and onion.
Add carrots and bell peppers. Cook briefly.
Add vinegar, sugar, ketchup, and water. Simmer.
Thicken sauce with cornstarch slurry.
Pour sauce over the fried fish.
Serve immediately.

title: Ginataang Langka
summary: Unripe jackfruit stewed in coconut milk with shrimp or pork.
description: A creamy vegetable dish using unripe jackfruit (langka) which has a meat-like texture. It is simmered in coconut milk with spices and often paired with shrimp, pork, or dried fish (daing).
steps: Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger.
Add pork (if using) and brown. If using shrimp, add later.
Add jackfruit and cook for 2 minutes.
Pour in coconut milk and simmer until jackfruit is tender.
Add shrimp (if using) and chilies. Season with bagoong.
Simmer until sauce thickens.
Serve hot.

title: Puto Cheese
summary: Soft, fluffy steamed rice cakes topped with melted cheese.
description: A favorite Filipino snack or side dish. These small, white steamed cakes are slightly sweet and topped with a slice of cheese. Perfect pair for Dinuguan or Pancit.
steps: Sift flour, sugar, and baking powder into a bowl.
Add milk, egg, water, and melted butter. Mix until smooth.
Pour batter into greased puto molds (fill 3/4 full).
Top with cheese slices.
Steam for 10-15 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Remove from molds and serve.

title: Arroz a la Cubana
summary: Ground beef hash served with fried egg, plantains, and rice.
description: A hearty meal featuring savory ground beef (giniling) cooked with potatoes, carrots, raisins, and peas. It is distinctively served with fried saba bananas, a fried egg, and rice.
steps: Sauté garlic and onion. Add ground beef and cook until brown.
Add tomato sauce, potatoes, and carrots. Simmer until veggies are tender.
Add raisins and green peas. Season with salt and pepper.
Fry the saba bananas and eggs separately.
Serve the beef mixture with rice, fried egg, and fried banana on the side.

title: Almondigas (Misua Soup with Meatballs)
summary: Comforting soup with thin flour noodles and savory pork meatballs.
description: A simple, budget-friendly soup. Delicate misua noodles are cooked in a broth with meatballs (bola-bola) and patola (sponge gourd). Perfect for rainy days.
steps: Mix ground pork, egg, minced onion, salt, and flour. Form into small balls.
Sauté garlic and onion in a pot. Add water and bring to a boil.
Drop meatballs into boiling water. Cook until they float.
Add patola and cook for 2 minutes.
Add misua noodles. Cook for 1 minute (they cook very fast).
Season with fish sauce and pepper. Serve immediately.

title: Bistek Tagalog
summary: Filipino beef steak marinated in soy sauce and calamansi, topped with onion rings.
description: Thin slices of beef sirloin marinated in a mixture of soy sauce and calamansi, then pan-fried and served with plenty of onion rings and the savory marinade sauce.
steps: Marinate beef in soy sauce, calamansi, garlic, and pepper for at least 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan. Fry onion rings until slightly soft but crisp. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, fry beef slices until browned. Remove beef.
Pour the marinade into the pan and simmer for 2 minutes.
Return beef to the pan and toss in the sauce.
Top with fried onion rings and serve.

title: Seafood Kare-Kare
summary: A lighter version of the classic peanut stew featuring shrimp, squid, and mussels.
description: For those who love the rich peanut sauce of Kare-Kare but prefer seafood over oxtail. This version features fresh shrimp, squid rings, and mussels simmered in a thick, golden peanut sauce with vegetables.
steps: Blanch the vegetables separately and set aside.
Sauté garlic and onion. Add peanut butter and fish stock. Mix well.
Add annatto water for color. Bring to a simmer.
Thicken with cornstarch slurry if needed.
Add the seafood (shrimp, squid, mussels). Cook for 3-5 minutes until done. Do not overcook.
Add the blanched vegetables.
Serve hot with bagoong (shrimp paste) on the side.

title: Chicken Inasal (Bacolod Style)
summary: Grilled chicken marinated in lemongrass, calamansi, and annatto oil.
description: The pride of Bacolod. Chicken pieces are marinated in a unique blend of vinegar, calamansi, lemongrass, and ginger, then grilled over charcoal while being basted with annatto oil (chicken oil).
steps: Combine lemongrass, calamansi, vinegar, ginger, garlic, sugar, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
Marinate chicken for at least 3 hours or overnight.
Prepare charcoal grill.
Grill chicken over medium heat, turning occasionally.
Bast generously with annatto oil/chicken oil while grilling.
Cook until internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
Serve with garlic rice and spiced vinegar.

title: La Paz Batchoy
summary: Iloilo's famous noodle soup with pork offal, crushed chicharon, and raw egg.
description: A rich noodle soup originating from La Paz, Iloilo. It features miki noodles in a flavorful broth made from pork and beef bones, topped with pork liver, intestines, crushed chicharon, and a raw egg cracked on top.
steps: Boil bones with onions and salt for 3 hours to make a rich stock. Strain.
Add shrimp paste and sugar to the broth. Keep boiling hot.
Blanch noodles and place in bowls.
Top with sliced pork belly, liver, and intestines (if using).
Pour boiling broth over the noodles.
Crack a raw egg on top.
Garnish generously with crushed chicharon, fried garlic, and spring onions.

title: Pinapaitan (Papaitan)
summary: A bitter goat or beef stew flavored with bile and tamarind.
description: An Ilocano delicacy known for its distinct bitter flavor from bile (papait). Made with goat or beef innards (tripe, liver, heart) and flavored with ginger, garlic, onion, and tamarind or calamansi.

ingredients.name: Beef or Goat innards (tripe, liver, heart)

steps: Clean innards thoroughly. Boil with ginger until tender. Slice into small pieces.
Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger.
Add the sliced innards and cook until browned.
Pour in broth (from boiling) or water. Simmer.
Add bile gradually until desired bitterness is reached.
Add calamansi juice and green chilies.
Simmer for another 15 minutes. Serve hot.

title: Lechon Paksiw
summary: Leftover lechon stewed in a sweet and tangy liver sauce.
description: The best way to repurpose leftover Lechon or Lechon Kawali. The meat is simmered in a sauce made of vinegar, sugar, and lechon sauce (liver sauce), creating a sweet, tangy, and savory stew.
steps: In a pot, combine leftover lechon, garlic, onion, bay leaves, peppercorns, vinegar, sugar, and water.
Bring to a boil without stirring.
Pour in the lechon sauce.
Simmer on low heat for 30-40 minutes until meat is very tender and sauce thickens.
Adjust sweetness or sourness to taste.
Serve with rice.

title: Adobong Kangkong
summary: Water spinach sautéed in soy sauce, vinegar, and lots of garlic.
description: A simple, healthy, and affordable vegetable dish. Kangkong (water spinach) leaves and stalks are cooked adobo-style with soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, and sometimes topped with crispy pork bits.
steps: Separate kangkong leaves from stalks.
Sauté garlic and onion in oil until fragrant.
Add the kangkong stalks first (they take longer to cook). Stir fry for 1 minute.
Add soy sauce and vinegar. Do not stir for a minute.
Add the leaves and pepper. Cover and let steam for 1 minute.
Toss everything together until leaves are wilted but still bright green.
Top with toasted garlic and serve.

title: Picadillo (Giniling na Baka)
summary: Ground beef stew with potatoes, carrots, raisins, and bell peppers.
description: A versatile ground beef dish (giniling) cooked in tomato sauce with diced potatoes, carrots, and bell peppers. Often includes raisins for a touch of sweetness. Great with rice or as a filling for bread.
steps: Sauté garlic and onion.
Add ground beef and cook until brown.
Add soy sauce and tomato sauce. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Add water, potatoes, and carrots. Cover and cook until veggies are tender.
Add bell peppers and raisins. Simmer for another 3 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve with rice or bread.

title: Maja Blanca
summary: Creamy coconut pudding with corn kernels, topped with cheese or latik.
description: A popular Filipino dessert often served at fiestas. It's a smooth, creamy coconut pudding thickened with cornstarch, mixed with sweet corn kernels, and topped with cheese or toasted coconut curds.
steps: In a pot, mix coconut milk, sugar, condensed milk, and sweet corn. Bring to a gentle boil.
Dissolve cornstarch in fresh milk.
Lower heat and slowly pour the cornstarch mixture into the pot while stirring constantly.
Cook until the mixture thickens to a pudding consistency.
Pour into a tray or mold. Smooth the top.
Sprinkle grated cheese on top.
Let cool and set in the refrigerator before slicing.

title: Filipino Chicken Macaroni Salad
summary: Sweet and savory pasta salad with chicken, pineapple, raisins, and cheese.
description: A staple at Filipino parties and Christmas dinners. Elbow macaroni is tossed in a sweetened mayonnaise dressing with shredded chicken, pineapple tidbits, carrots, raisins, and cheese cubes.
steps: Cook macaroni according to package instructions. Drain and let cool.
In a large bowl, combine mayonnaise and condensed milk.
Add chicken, pineapple, carrots, raisins, cheese, and onion.
Fold in the macaroni until well coated.
Season with salt and pepper.
Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.

title: Beef Mechado
summary: Tangy beef stew with potatoes and carrots in a rich tomato sauce.
description: Similar to Kaldereta and Afritada but distinct for its use of soy sauce and citrus (calamansi or lemon) in the tomato sauce, giving it a deeper, tangier flavor profile. Often made with larded beef.
steps: Marinate beef in soy sauce and calamansi for 30 minutes.
Sear beef in a pot until browned. Set aside.
Sauté garlic and onion. Return beef to pot.
Add tomato sauce and water. Bring to a boil.
Simmer for 1-1.5 hours until beef is tender.
Add potatoes and carrots. Cook until tender.
Add bell peppers and simmer for 2 minutes.
Serve hot.

title: Ginataang Tilapia
summary: Fried tilapia stewed in rich coconut milk with pechay.
description: A creamy and savory fish dish. Tilapia is fried first to keep its shape, then simmered in coconut milk flavored with ginger, garlic, and onions, with leafy greens like pechay or spinach added at the end.
steps: Season tilapia with salt. Fry until golden brown. Set aside.
In a pan, sauté garlic, onion, and ginger.
Pour in coconut milk and bring to a simmer.
Add the fried tilapia and green chilies.
Simmer for 5-10 minutes to let flavors absorb.
Add pechay leaves and cook for 1 minute.
Serve hot.

title: Classic Pancit Canton
summary: Stir-fried wheat noodles with pork, shrimp, and colorful vegetables.
description: A birthday staple symbolizing long life. Flour sticks (canton noodles) are stir-fried with soy sauce, oyster sauce, pork slices, shrimp, and a medley of vegetables like carrots, beans, and cabbage.
steps: Sauté garlic and onion. Add pork and cook until brown.
Add shrimp and cook briefly. Remove shrimp and set aside.
Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, and chicken stock. Bring to a boil.
Add vegetables and cook for 2 minutes. Remove veggies and set aside.
Add noodles to the boiling liquid. Cook until liquid is absorbed.
Toss back the meat, shrimp, and vegetables.
Mix well and serve with calamansi.

title: Lumpiang Sariwa (Fresh Spring Roll)
summary: Fresh vegetable crepe roll with peanut garlic sauce.
description: A healthy alternative to fried lumpia. A mix of sautéed vegetables (ubod/heart of palm, carrots, beans) wrapped in a soft homemade crepe, topped with a sweet savory peanut sauce and minced garlic.

ingredients.name: Ubod (Heart of Palm) or Singkamas, julienned
Sauce: Soy sauce, sugar, water, cornstarch, peanut butter

steps: Make wrappers: Mix flour, egg, water, oil. Cook thin crepes in a non-stick pan.
Sauté garlic and onion. Add pork/shrimp. Add vegetables and cook until tender-crisp.
Make sauce: Boil water, soy sauce, sugar. Thicken with cornstarch. Stir in peanut butter.
Assemble: Place lettuce on wrapper. Add vegetable filling. Roll and seal.
Pour sauce over the roll.
Garnish with crushed peanuts and minced fresh garlic.

title: Spicy Beef Kaldereta
summary: Rich tomato-based beef stew with liver spread, cheese, and chili.
description: A popular fiesta dish. Beef chunks are stewed until tender in a thick tomato sauce enriched with liver spread (giving it a distinct savory depth), cheese, bell peppers, olives, and chili.
steps: Sear beef cubes until brown. Set aside.
Sauté garlic and onion. Add beef back.
Add tomato sauce and water. Simmer for 1.5 hours until beef is tender.
Add liver spread and chili. Stir to thicken sauce.
Add potatoes and carrots. Cook until tender.
Add bell peppers, olives, and cheese. Simmer until cheese melts.
Serve hot.

title: Ginataang Sitaw at Kalabasa
summary: Squash and string beans simmered in coconut milk with shrimp paste.
description: A classic everyday vegetable dish. Sweet squash (kalabasa) and crisp string beans (sitaw) are cooked in coconut milk flavored with shrimp paste (bagoong) and sometimes topped with pork or shrimp.
steps: Sauté garlic and onion. Add pork (if using) and brown.
Add squash and cook for 2 minutes.
Pour in coconut milk. Simmer until squash is half-cooked.
Add string beans and shrimp (if using).
Season with shrimp paste.
Simmer until vegetables are cooked but not mushy.
Serve hot.

title: Filipino Pork Barbecue
summary: Sweet and savory grilled pork skewers, a street food favorite.
description: Thin slices of pork marinated in a sweet soy-ketchup-calamansi mixture, skewered on bamboo sticks, and grilled over charcoal. The glaze caramelizes into a sticky, smoky, delicious coating.
steps: Mix all marinade ingredients in a bowl.
Marinate pork slices overnight for best results.
Thread pork onto bamboo skewers.
Grill over charcoal, turning frequently.
Baste with the remaining marinade (boiled) mixed with a little oil.
Cook until charred and glazed.
Serve with spiced vinegar.

title: Ginataang Mais
summary: Sweet rice porridge with corn kernels and coconut milk.
description: A simple afternoon snack (merienda). Glutinous rice is cooked with water, coconut milk, sugar, and corn kernels until thick and creamy. Comforting served warm or cold.
steps: Wash glutinous rice.
In a pot, combine rice, water, and coconut milk.
Bring to a boil, then lower heat to simmer.
Stir occasionally to prevent sticking.
When rice is almost cooked, add corn and sugar.
Simmer until rice is soft and mixture is thick.
Serve warm.

title: Adobong Sitaw
summary: String beans cooked adobo-style with pork bits.
description: Crunchy string beans (sitaw) braised in the classic soy sauce and vinegar mixture. Usually cooked with small pieces of pork belly for flavor.
steps: Sauté garlic and onion.
Add pork and cook until brown.
Add soy sauce and water. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Add string beans. Cook until tender-crisp.
Add vinegar and let simmer for a minute without stirring.
Toss well and serve.

title: Fish Tinola
summary: Clear fish soup with ginger, leafy greens, and sayote.
description: A lighter variation of Chicken Tinola using fresh fish (like Tuna or Lapu-Lapu). The broth is flavored with ginger and onions, served with sayote or papaya and malunggay or chili leaves.
steps: Boil water/rice wash with ginger and onion.
Add sayote/papaya. Cook until half-tender.
Add fish slices. Simmer gently so fish doesn't break.
Season with fish sauce.
Add leafy greens and turn off heat.
Serve hot.

title: Tortang Dulong
summary: Silver fish omelet patties, crispy on the outside and soft inside.
